meanings.definition: The act of fringing or bordering with a narrow band.
meanings.sent1: The fimbriation of the curtain added a delicate touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a fimbriation of lace along the edge of the tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The fimbriation of glitter on the birthday card made it sparkle.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a fimbriation of humor, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The fimbriation of colorful flowers along the path brightened the garden.

meanings.sent1: The painting was enhanced by a fimbriation of gold leaf around the frame.
meanings.sent2: The book cover had a fimbriation of intricate patterns along the spine.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with a fimbriation of tiny sugar pearls.
meanings.sent4: Her scarf was a fimbriation of warmth on the chilly day.
meanings.sent5: The fimbriation of silver thread on the pillow added a touch of elegance.
